column4: When i try to mount my hard drive on the live cd it gives me these errors. anyone got an idea why? errors:error: device /dev/sda1 is not removable
When i try to mount my hard drive on the live cd it gives me these errors. anyone got an idea why? errors:error: device /dev/sda1 is not removable
I get these errors. any idea why? (Currently running off a live cd.)
forget this. Ill just go into my install and backup from there.
what ar eyou trying to do?
Im trying to make a windows partition but currently ubuntu takes up my entire hard drive. I need to drop some space from it to make a partition for windows and a partition both can acess.
hmm so are you using gpart?
yeah. I don't know if its safe just to remove space from linux though. I know it wasn't for windows.
Do you know if it's safe to remove space from linux? Do i need to find a way to defrag my drive or anything before removing space?
you don't need to defrag your drive in linux
ok. so removing space shouldn't be an issue. Got it.
if you use gpart it should be safe to resize your disk
I can't mount it at this time. Im not really worried about loosing anything either.
